channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: American Voter: Sophia Madana
item.description: Al Jazeera asks the same key questions about the presidential election to voters across the United States.

item.title: Liverpool, Man Utd lick wounds after humiliating defeats
item.description: The defending champions let in seven goals against Villa while United was beaten 6-1 by Tottenham.

item.title: Afghan president Ghani arrives in Qatar as peace talks drag on
item.description: Ashraf Ghani will hold meetings with Qatari and Afghan leaders but will not hold a meeting with Taliban officials.

item.title: Iran’s delicate balancing act in the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict
item.description: Iran shares borders with Armenia and Azerbaijan, and is home to communities with origins in both countries.

item.title: Humour, resignation, despair: Living with inflation in Iran
item.description: Iranians take to social media to chronicle the blistering effects of soaring inflation and US economic sanctions.

item.title: Chile referendum: Can it bring true equality?
item.description: Chileans will vote this month on whether to adopt a new political constitution.

item.title: Oman becomes first Gulf state to reinstate ambassador in Syria
item.description: Oman is one of the rare Arab countries that maintained diplomatic relations with President Bashar al-Assad's government.

item.title: Egyptians struggle as authorities crackdown on illegal housing
item.description: People complain of high fees to regularise buildings as October government deadline looms.

item.title: Protests in Kyrgyzstan over alleged vote rigging
item.description: Opposition supporters protesting after early results show two pro-government parties winning 107 out of 120 seats.

item.title: In Czech Republic, a fresh state of emergency as second wave hits
item.description: Czechs held a COVID farewell party and the country was hailed for handling the pandemic. Why are cases rising again?

item.title: In Pictures: Indian man cremates COVID-19 victims despite stigma
item.description: Braving infection and stigma, Ramananda Sarkar lights funeral pyres at crematorium in Assam dedicated to the virus dead.

item.title: Nagorno-Karabakh: Key cities targeted in Armenian, Azeri shelling
item.description: Civilian casualties reported as conflict over Nagorno-Karabakh spills into second week, prompting fresh ceasefire calls.

item.title: US-UK trio win Nobel Medicine Prize for Hepatitis C discovery
item.description: Two American and one British-born scientist won the 2020 Nobel Prize for work in identifying the Hepatitis C virus.

item.title: India sees 100,000 COVID-19 deaths: What happened and what now?
item.description: Al Jazeera speaks to leading health experts who analyse India's COVID-19 response so far and suggest the way forward.

item.title: Suicide car bomb targets Afghan governor, many killed: Officials
item.description: Car bomb targeting governor of eastern Laghman province leaves at least eight dead and dozens wounded, officials say.

item.title: Fishing emerges as a hurdle as Brexit talks enter key phase
item.description: Two weeks of talks begin as France resists UK bid to replace fishing quotas that London says unfairly favour EU fleets.

item.title: Financial markets breathe easier as Trump shows signs of recovery
item.description: US and Asian stocks, and oil prices, rise after US president's doctors say he may be discharged as early as Monday.

item.title: It is time reparations are paid for Roma slavery
item.description: Romanians continue to actively deny the history of Roma enslavement in Romanian lands.

item.title: Biden is winning with undecided voters
item.description: His debate performance and response to Trump's COVID-19 diagnosis has been the calm amid a chaotic election cycle.

item.title: Guatemala sends back some 3,500 migrants amid COVID-19 concerns
item.description: President Giammattei said the caravan could raise the risk of coronavirus contagion.

item.title: Eight migrants drown after forced off boat by smugglers
item.description: The IOM said 12 others are missing while 14 survived the incident off Djibouti's coast.

item.title: ‘It was sheer hatred’: The Indigenous woman taunted as she died
item.description: In Canada, Indigenous people react to the video of Joyce Echaquan being racially abused as she lay dying in hospital.

item.title: Naftali Bennett’s secret to power: He is not Netanyahu
item.description: Netanyahu's downfall might mark the rise of another Israeli leader, even more right-wing than him.

item.title: Nigeria’s railway people: Life alongside a high-speed rail link
item.description: A Chinese-backed railway was supposed to reinvigorate communities along its route, but residents have mixed feelings.

item.title: Tasmanian devils back on Australian mainland after 3,000 years
item.description: Feisty marsupial released in sanctuary in an attempt to revive population ravaged by a contagious facial cancer.
